StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Newborn Screening Translational Research Network (NBSTRN): Newborn Sequencing in Genomic Medicine and Public Health (NSIGHT)

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: Approved Users are expected to acknowledge the Submitting Investigator(s) who submitted data from the original study to an NIH-designated data repository, the primary funding organization that supported the Submitting Investigator(s), and the NIH-designated data repository (e.g., dbGaP). The acknowledgment statement should include the dbGaP accession number to the specific version of the dataset(s) analyzed.(1) NBSTRN acknowledgement - This project has been funded in whole or in part with Federal funds from the NICHD, National Institutes of Health, Department of Health and Human Services, under Contract No. HHSN275201800005C. (2) BabySeq acknowledgement – The authors would like to thank the families for their participation in the BabySeq Project. Research reported in this publication was supported by the National Institutes of Health under award numbers U19HD077671, R01HD075802, and U41HG006834; (3) NSIGHT2 acknowledgement -This study was supported by grant U19HD077693 from NICHD and NHGRI to S.F.K., grant UL1TR002550 from NCATS to E.J. Topol, and gifts from the Liguori Family , John Motter and Effie Simanikas , Ernest and Evelyn Rady , and Rady Children’s Hospital.; (4) NC NEXUS acknowledgement - The authors would like to acknowledge important contributions to this study made by Samuel Demers, Karen Dorman, James P. Evans, Ann Katherine Foreman, Amber Ivins, Marjorie Margolis, Julianne O’Daniel, Phillips Owen, Kirk Wilhelmsen, and the North Carolina Translational and Clinical Sciences Institute, National Institutes of Health (grant 1UL1TR001111). The NC NEXUS study is funded by grant U19HD077632 from the Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development and the National Human Genome Research Institute (RFA-HD-13-010). ; (5) NBSeq acknowledgement – The NBSeq project at the University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is funded by grant 5U19HD077627 from the Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development and the National Human Genome Research Institute (RFA-HD-13-010).

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use
ConsentGroup.name: GRU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification.

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (IRB, PUB)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-IRB-PUB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community.

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical
ConsentGroup.name: HMB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry.

StudyTo.name: dbGaP Collection: Compilation of Individual-Level Genomic Data for General Research Use
